mainEntity.name: What does the basic operations calculator do?

acceptedAnswer.text: It adds, subtracts, multiplies, or divides two numbers and shows the result instantly.
No. The calculator warns you when the second value is zero because division by zero is undefined.

structuredData.name: Calculate a percentage increase or decrease
structuredData.description: Use starting and ending values to determine percent change.

step.text: Subtract the starting value from the ending value.
Divide the difference by the starting value.
Multiply by 100 to convert the change into a percentage.

structuredData.name: Explore unit circle values
structuredData.description: Map angles to sine, cosine, and tangent values using the interactive unit circle.

step.text: Enter an angle in degrees or radians.
Snap to a special angle on the circle to reveal exact values.
Read the quadrant, reference angle, and trig outputs.

mainEntity.name: How do I solve a triangle when all three sides are known?

acceptedAnswer.text: Enter sides a, b, and c. The calculator applies the Law of Cosines and Law of Sines to compute the angles.

mainEntity.name: What happens if SSA creates two possible triangles?

acceptedAnswer.text: The calculator reports both solutions, including the ambiguous SSA case, and renders the primary diagram.

structuredData.name: Graph trigonometric functions
structuredData.description: Enter an angle, adjust amplitude and period, and analyze sin, cos, tan, sec, csc, and cot outputs.

step.text: Calculate all six trigonometric values from the selected angle.
Adjust the amplitude and period controls to reshape the wave.
Inspect the graph to observe periodicity and asymptotes.

mainEntity.name: What inputs are valid for arcsin or arccos?

acceptedAnswer.text: Values between -1 and 1 only. The calculator validates the input and prevents invalid entries.

mainEntity.name: How do I list all solutions in an interval?

acceptedAnswer.text: Set custom interval boundaries and the calculator lists every solution using periodic extensions of the principal value.

structuredData.name: Use the Law of Sines and Cosines
structuredData.description: Provide known sides or angles, apply the appropriate trig law, and compute the remaining triangle values.

step.text: Enter at least three consistent values that include one side.
Let auto detection choose the Law of Sines or Cosines, or override the method.
Review the solved sides, angles, area, and diagram.
